## Overview

By the end of this lesson, students will be able to create a GitHub repository for their website and configure the basic settings for hosting on GitHub Pages \## Learning Objectives

-   Students will be able to Create a repository for website and initialize a GitHub Pages branch.

-   Students will be able Upload Your Website Files

-   Students will be able to view website

## Lesson

hosting on github Hosting on GitHub typically refers to using GitHub Pages, a built-in service provided by GitHub for hosting static websites directly from your GitHub repository. GitHub Pages is a convenient and free way to showcase your projects, portfolio, documentation, or any other static content.

### Let begin

1.  Log in to GitHub.

2.  Create a Repository: Go to your GitHub profile and click on the "+" sign to create a new repository. Name your repository(choose any preferred name).

3.  Add Your Website Files: Upload your website files to the repository by highlighting and dragging and dropping into your repository

![](images/highlight%20files.png){height="300"}

![](images/drag%20and%20drop.png){height="300"}

4.  commit changes

5.  Enable GitHub Pages: In your repository, go to the "Settings" tab. Scroll down to the "GitHub Pages" section and click 'check out here'

![](images/check%20out%20here.png){height="300"}

Under "Source," select the branch you want to use (usually main or master). file should be /docs\* Click "Save."

![](images/main.png){height="300"}

![](images/save.png){height="300"}

6.  click on the link attached 'your site is ready to be published' to veiw your site ![](images/veiw%20websitee.png){height="300"}

## Conclusion

you should be able to veiw and share your website with everyone
